physDesc.p: The addition of interrogativus signs to some of the Scriptural quotations on 134r are a revisor's emendations. The main hand only uses a punctus versus for these, either because he has no Latin literacy or because the script does not implement the interrogativus; the latter can be seen by other examples of questions in Old English throughout the MS, see e.g. fol. 140r-v. R. Fulk (2017) discusses Latin illiteracy issues and scribal emendations in another anonymous homily in this MS.

handNote.p: Main scribe of the manuscript. A square Anglo-Saxon miniscule, described by Ker as 'handsome'.
